meanings.definition: A person or thing that is particularly impressive or outstanding in a performance or event.
meanings.sent1: The magician's final trick was the showstopper of the night.
meanings.sent2: The fireworks display was full of colorful showstoppers.
meanings.sent3: The talented dog became the showstopper at the circus when it started dancing.
meanings.sent4: Her radiant smile was the showstopper that lit up the entire room.
meanings.sent5: The grand finale of the concert was a showstopper that left the audience in awe.

meanings.definition: Something that causes a halt or interruption in a show or performance.
meanings.sent1: Technical difficulties became the unexpected showstopper during the play.
meanings.sent2: The power outage was a major showstopper during the live broadcast.
meanings.sent3: The missing prop turned out to be the showstopper that led to comedic improvisation.
meanings.sent4: The sudden rainstorm acted as a showstopper, forcing everyone to seek shelter.
meanings.sent5: The loud noise backstage created a showstopper moment that surprised the actors.
